00050 cache_inode_status_t cache_inode_is_dir_empty( cache_entry_t * pentry )
00051 {
00052   cache_inode_status_t   status ;
00053   cache_entry_t        * pentry_iter ;
00054 
00055   /* Sanity check */
00056   if( pentry->internal_md.type != DIR_BEGINNING )
00057     return CACHE_INODE_BAD_TYPE ;
00058 
00059   /* Initialisation */
00060   status = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00061   pentry_iter = pentry ;
00062    
00063   do
00064     {
00065       if( pentry_iter->internal_md.type == DIR_BEGINNING )
00066         {
00067           if( pentry_iter->object.dir_begin.nbactive != 0 )
00068             {
00069               status = CACHE_INODE_DIR_NOT_EMPTY ;
00070               break ;
00071             }
00072           
00073           if( pentry_iter->object.dir_begin.end_of_dir == END_OF_DIR )
00074             break ;
00075           
00076           pentry_iter = pentry_iter->object.dir_begin.pdir_cont ;
00077         }
00078       else
00079         {
00080           if( pentry_iter->object.dir_cont.nbactive != 0 )
00081             {
00082               status = CACHE_INODE_DIR_NOT_EMPTY ;
00083               break ;
00084             }
00085           
00086           if( pentry_iter->object.dir_cont.end_of_dir == END_OF_DIR )
00087             break ;
00088           
00089           pentry_iter = pentry_iter->object.dir_cont.pdir_cont ;
00090         }
00091     } while( pentry_iter != NULL ) ;
00092   
00093   return status ;
00094 } /* cache_inode_is_dir_empty */

00110 cache_inode_status_t cache_inode_is_dir_empty_WithLock( cache_entry_t * pentry )
00111 {
00112    cache_inode_status_t status ;
00113 
00114    P_r( &pentry->lock ) ;
00115    status = cache_inode_is_dir_empty( pentry ) ;
00116    V_r( &pentry->lock ) ;
00117 
00118    return status ;
00119 } /* cache_inode_is_dir_empty_WithLock */

00121 
00130 cache_inode_status_t cache_inode_clean_internal(cache_entry_t        * to_remove_entry,
00131                                                 hash_table_t         * ht,  
00132                                                 cache_inode_client_t * pclient)
00133 {
00134        fsal_handle_t           * pfsal_handle_remove ;
00135        cache_inode_parent_entry_t * parent_iter      = NULL ;
00136        cache_inode_parent_entry_t * parent_iter_next = NULL ;
00137        cache_inode_fsal_data_t   fsaldata ;
00138        cache_inode_status_t      status;
00139        hash_buffer_t             key, old_key, old_value ;
00140        int                       rc;
00141   
00142       if( ( pfsal_handle_remove =  cache_inode_get_fsal_handle( to_remove_entry, &status ) ) == NULL )
00143         {
00144           return status ;
00145         }
00146        
00147        
00148       /* Invalidate the related LRU gc entry (no more required) */
00149       if( to_remove_entry->gc_lru_entry != NULL )
00150         {
00151           if( LRU_invalidate( to_remove_entry->gc_lru, to_remove_entry->gc_lru_entry ) != LRU_LIST_SUCCESS )
00152             {
00153               return CACHE_INODE_LRU_ERROR ;
00154             }
00155         }
00156       
00157       /* delete the entry from the cache */
00158       fsaldata.handle = *pfsal_handle_remove ;
00159       if( to_remove_entry->internal_md.type !=  DIR_CONTINUE )
00160         fsaldata.cookie = DIR_START ;
00161       else
00162         fsaldata.cookie = to_remove_entry->object.dir_cont.dir_cont_pos ;
00163       
00164       if( cache_inode_fsaldata_2_key( &key, &fsaldata, pclient ) )
00165         {
00166           return CACHE_INODE_INCONSISTENT_ENTRY ;
00167         }
00168       
00169       /* use the key to delete the entry */
00170       rc = HashTable_Del( ht, &key, &old_key, &old_value ) ;
00171       
00172       if (rc) DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_CRIT, "HashTable_Del error %d in cache_inode_clean_internal", rc );
00173       
00174       if( (rc != HASHTABLE_SUCCESS) && (rc != HASHTABLE_ERROR_NO_SUCH_KEY) )
00175         {
00176           cache_inode_release_fsaldata_key( &key, pclient ) ;
00177           return CACHE_INODE_INCONSISTENT_ENTRY ;
00178         }
00179         
00180       /* release the key that was stored in hash table */
00181       if ( rc != HASHTABLE_ERROR_NO_SUCH_KEY )
00182       {
00183           cache_inode_release_fsaldata_key( &old_key, pclient ) ;
00184       
00185           /* Sanity check: old_value.pdata is expected to be equal to pentry,
00186            * and is released later in this function */
00187           if ( (cache_entry_t*)old_value.pdata != to_remove_entry )
00188           {
00189                DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_CRIT,
00190                                  "cache_inode_remove: unexpected pdata %p from hash table (pentry=%p)",
00191                                   old_value.pdata, to_remove_entry ) ;
00192           }
00193       }
00194             
00195       /* release the key used for hash query */
00196       cache_inode_release_fsaldata_key( &key, pclient ) ;
00197 
00198       
00199       /* Free the parent list entries */
00200       
00201       parent_iter = to_remove_entry->parent_list  ;
00202       while( parent_iter != NULL ) 
00203         {
00204           parent_iter_next = parent_iter->next_parent ;
00205 
00206           RELEASE_PREALLOC( parent_iter, pclient->pool_parent, next_alloc ) ;
00207 
00208           parent_iter = parent_iter_next ;
00209         }      
00210       
00211       /* If entry is a DIR_CONTINUE or a DIR_BEGINNING, release pdir_data */
00212       if( to_remove_entry->internal_md.type == DIR_BEGINNING )
00213         {
00214           /* Put the pentry back to the pool */
00215           RELEASE_PREALLOC( to_remove_entry->object.dir_begin.pdir_data, pclient->pool_dir_data, next_alloc ) ;
00216         }
00217       
00218       if( to_remove_entry->internal_md.type == DIR_CONTINUE )
00219         {
00220           /* Put the pentry back to the pool */
00221           RELEASE_PREALLOC( to_remove_entry->object.dir_cont.pdir_data, pclient->pool_dir_data, next_alloc ) ;
00222         }
00223     
00224       return CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS;
00225 } /* cache_inode_clean_internal */
00226

00247 cache_inode_status_t cache_inode_remove_sw( cache_entry_t        * pentry,     
00248                                             fsal_name_t          * pnode_name,
00249                                             fsal_attrib_list_t   * pattr,
00250                                             hash_table_t         * ht,  
00251                                             cache_inode_client_t * pclient, 
00252                                             fsal_op_context_t    * pcontext, 
00253                                             cache_inode_status_t * pstatus,
00254                                             int                    use_mutex )
00255 {
00256   fsal_status_t             fsal_status ;
00257   cache_entry_t           * parent_entry ;
00258   cache_entry_t           * pentry_iter ;
00259   cache_entry_t           * pentry_next ;
00260   cache_entry_t           * to_remove_entry ;
00261   fsal_handle_t             fsal_handle_parent ;
00262   fsal_attrib_list_t        remove_attr ;
00263   fsal_attrib_list_t        after_attr ;
00264   cache_inode_status_t      status ;
00265   cache_content_status_t    cache_content_status ;
00266   int                       to_remove_numlinks = 0 ;
00267   
00268   /* stats */
00269   pclient->stat.nb_call_total += 1 ;
00270   pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_call[CACHE_INODE_REMOVE] += 1 ;
00271 
00272   /* Looks up for the entry to remove */
00273   if( ( to_remove_entry = cache_inode_lookup_sw( pentry, 
00274                                                  pnode_name, 
00275                                                  &remove_attr, 
00276                                                  ht, 
00277                                                  pclient, 
00278                                                  pcontext, 
00279                                                  &status, 
00280                                                  use_mutex ) ) == NULL )
00281     {
00282       *pstatus = status ;
00283       return *pstatus ; 
00284     }
00285 
00286   /* pentry is a directory */
00287   if( use_mutex )
00288     P_w( &pentry->lock ) ;
00289   
00290   if( pentry->internal_md.type != DIR_BEGINNING && pentry->internal_md.type != DIR_CONTINUE )
00291     {
00292       if( use_mutex )
00293         V_w( &pentry->lock ) ;
00294       
00295       *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_BAD_TYPE   ;
00296       return *pstatus;
00297     } 
00298 
00299   /* Non-empty directories should not be removed. If entry is of type DIR_CONTINUE, then the directory is not empty */
00300   if( to_remove_entry->internal_md.type == DIR_CONTINUE )
00301     {
00302       if( use_mutex )
00303         V_w( &pentry->lock ) ;
00304       
00305       *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_DIR_NOT_EMPTY ;
00306       return *pstatus;
00307     }
00308   
00309   /* A directory is empty if none of its pdir_chain itemps contains something */
00310   if( to_remove_entry->internal_md.type == DIR_BEGINNING &&
00311       to_remove_entry->object.dir_begin.has_been_readdir == CACHE_INODE_YES )
00312     {
00313       if( cache_inode_is_dir_empty( to_remove_entry ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00314         { 
00315           if( use_mutex )
00316              V_w( &pentry->lock ) ;
00317 
00318           *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_DIR_NOT_EMPTY ;
00319           return *pstatus ;
00320         }
00321     }
00322   
00323    /* We have to get parent's fsal handle */
00324   parent_entry = pentry ;
00325 
00326   /* /!\ Possible deadlocks in this area: make sure to P(DIR_BEGIN)/P(DIR_CONT)/V(DIR_CONT)/V(DIR_BEGIN) */
00327 
00328   if( pentry->internal_md.type == DIR_BEGINNING )
00329     {
00330       fsal_handle_parent = pentry->object.dir_begin.handle ;
00331     }
00332   else if( pentry->internal_md.type == DIR_CONTINUE )
00333     {
00334       if( use_mutex )
00335         P_r( &pentry->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin->lock ) ;
00336        
00337       fsal_handle_parent = pentry->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin->object.dir_begin.handle ;
00338 
00339       if( use_mutex )
00340         V_r( &pentry->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin->lock ) ;
00341     }
00342 
00343 
00344 
00345   if( status == CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00346     {
00347       /* Remove the file from FSAL */
00348       after_attr.asked_attributes = pclient->attrmask ;
00349 #ifdef _USE_MFSL
00350       cache_inode_get_attributes( pentry, &after_attr ) ;
00351       fsal_status =  MFSL_unlink( &pentry->mobject, pnode_name, pcontext, &pclient->mfsl_context, &after_attr ) ;
00352 #else
00353       fsal_status =  FSAL_unlink( &fsal_handle_parent, pnode_name, pcontext, &after_attr ) ;
00354 #endif
00355      
00356       /* Set the 'after' attr */
00357       if( pattr != NULL ) 
00358         *pattr = after_attr ; 
00359  
00360       if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status ) ) 
00361         {
00362           if( fsal_status.major == ERR_FSAL_STALE )
00363             {
00364                 cache_inode_status_t kill_status ;
00365 
00366                 DisplayLog( "cache_inode_remove: Stale FSAL FH detected for pentry %p", pentry ) ;
00367 
00368                 if( cache_inode_kill_entry( pentry, ht, pclient, &kill_status ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ) 
00369                   DisplayLog( "cache_inode_remove: Could not kill entry %p, status = %u", pentry, kill_status ) ;
00370 
00371                 *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_FSAL_ESTALE ;
00372             }
00373 
00374           *pstatus = cache_inode_error_convert( fsal_status ) ;
00375           if( use_mutex )
00376             V_w( &pentry->lock ) ;
00377           return *pstatus ;
00378         }
00379     }
00380   else
00381     {
00382       if( use_mutex )
00383         V_w( &pentry->lock ) ;
00384       pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_REMOVE] += 1 ;
00385       return status ;
00386     }
00387 
00388   /* lock the entry to be removed, because we are going to browse its parents list */
00389   if( use_mutex )
00390     P_w( &to_remove_entry->lock ) ;
00391     
00392   /* Remove the entry from parent dir_entries array */
00393   cache_inode_remove_cached_dirent( pentry, 
00394                                     pnode_name, 
00395                                     ht, 
00396                                     pclient, 
00397                                     &status )  ;
00398   
00399   DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, 
00400                      "cache_inode_remove_cached_dirent: status=%d", status ) ;
00401 
00402   /* Update the cached attributes */
00403   if( pentry->internal_md.type == DIR_BEGINNING )
00404     {
00405       pentry->object.dir_begin.attributes = after_attr ;
00406     }
00407   else if( pentry->internal_md.type == DIR_CONTINUE )
00408     {
00409       if( use_mutex )
00410         P_r( &pentry->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin->lock ) ;
00411 
00412       pentry->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin->object.dir_begin.attributes = after_attr ;
00413 
00414       if( use_mutex )
00415         V_r( &pentry->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin->lock ) ;
00416     }
00417   
00418   /* Update the attributes for the removed entry */
00419 
00420   if( remove_attr.type != FSAL_TYPE_DIR )
00421     {
00422       if( remove_attr.numlinks > 1 )
00423         {
00424           switch( to_remove_entry->internal_md.type )
00425             {
00426             case SYMBOLIC_LINK:
00427               to_remove_entry->object.symlink.attributes.numlinks -= 1 ;
00428               to_remove_entry->object.symlink.attributes.ctime.seconds = time( NULL ) ;
00429               to_remove_entry->object.symlink.attributes.ctime.nseconds = 0 ;
00430               to_remove_numlinks = to_remove_entry->object.symlink.attributes.numlinks ;
00431               break ;
00432 
00433             case REGULAR_FILE:
00434               to_remove_entry->object.file.attributes.numlinks -= 1 ;
00435               to_remove_entry->object.file.attributes.ctime.seconds = time( NULL ) ;
00436               to_remove_entry->object.file.attributes.ctime.nseconds = 0 ;
00437               to_remove_numlinks = to_remove_entry->object.file.attributes.numlinks ;
00438               break ;
00439               
00440             case CHARACTER_FILE:
00441             case BLOCK_FILE:
00442             case SOCKET_FILE:
00443             case FIFO_FILE:
00444               to_remove_entry->object.special_obj.attributes.numlinks -= 1 ;
00445               to_remove_entry->object.special_obj.attributes.ctime.seconds = time( NULL ) ;
00446               to_remove_entry->object.special_obj.attributes.ctime.nseconds = 0 ;
00447               to_remove_numlinks = to_remove_entry->object.special_obj.attributes.numlinks ;
00448               break ;
00449               
00450             default:
00451               /* Other objects should not be hard linked */
00452               if( use_mutex )
00453                 V_w( &to_remove_entry->lock ) ;
00454               *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_BAD_TYPE ;
00455               return *pstatus ;
00456               break ;
00457             }
00458         }
00459     }
00460   else
00461     {
00462       /* No hardlink counter to be decremented for a directory: hardlink are not allowed for them */
00463     }
00464   
00465   /* Now, delete "to_remove_entry" from the cache inode and free its associated resources, but only if numlinks == 0 */
00466   if( to_remove_numlinks == 0 )
00467     {
00468 
00469      /* If pentry is a regular file, data cached, the related data cache entry should be removed as well */
00470      if( to_remove_entry->internal_md.type == REGULAR_FILE )
00471       {
00472         if( to_remove_entry->object.file.pentry_content != NULL )
00473          {
00474             /* Something is to be deleted, release the cache data entry */
00475             if( cache_content_release_entry( (cache_content_entry_t  *)to_remove_entry->object.file.pentry_content ,
00476                                              (cache_content_client_t *)pclient->pcontent_client,
00477                                              &cache_content_status )  != CACHE_CONTENT_SUCCESS )
00478               {
00479                 DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_EVENT, 
00480                                    "pentry %p, named %s could not be released from data cache, status=%d",
00481                                     to_remove_entry, pnode_name->name, cache_content_status ) ;  
00482               }
00483          }
00484       }
00485 
00486       
00487       /* browse and clean all DIR_CONTINUEs */
00488       pentry_iter = to_remove_entry;
00489 
00490       while( pentry_iter )
00491       {
00492           /* remove current entry from hash, clear resources and invalidate LRUs */
00493           
00494           if ( (*pstatus = cache_inode_clean_internal(pentry_iter, ht, pclient)) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00495           {
00496               if( use_mutex )
00497               {
00498                 V_w( &pentry->lock ) ;
00499                 V_w( &to_remove_entry->lock ) ;
00500               }
00501               
00502               DisplayLogJdLevel(pclient->log_outputs, NIV_CRIT, "cache_inode_clean_internal ERROR %d", *pstatus );
00503               return *pstatus;
00504           }
00505           
00506           if ( pentry_iter->internal_md.type == DIR_BEGINNING )
00507           {
00508               /* next step : don't stop at end of dir,
00509                * because it may stay dircont with inactive entries.
00510                */
00511               pentry_next = pentry_iter->object.dir_begin.pdir_cont ;              
00512               
00513           }
00514           else if ( pentry_iter->internal_md.type == DIR_CONTINUE )
00515           {
00516                /* next step */
00517               pentry_next = pentry_iter->object.dir_cont.pdir_cont ;
00518 
00519               /*  can destroy mutex and put back entry to memory pool */
00520               cache_inode_mutex_destroy( pentry_iter ) ;
00521       
00522               RELEASE_PREALLOC( pentry_iter, pclient->pool_entry, next_alloc ) ;              
00523           }
00524           else /* not a directory, exiting loop */
00525             pentry_next = NULL;          
00526           
00527           pentry_iter = pentry_next;
00528       }
00529 
00530       /* Finally put the main pentry back to pool */
00531       if( use_mutex )
00532         V_w( &to_remove_entry->lock );
00533       
00534       /* Destroy the mutex associated with the pentry */
00535       cache_inode_mutex_destroy( to_remove_entry ) ;
00536       
00537       RELEASE_PREALLOC( to_remove_entry, pclient->pool_entry, next_alloc ) ;
00538     }
00539   
00540   /* Validate the entries */
00541   *pstatus = cache_inode_valid( pentry, CACHE_INODE_OP_SET, pclient ) ;  
00542 
00543   /* Regular exit */
00544   if( use_mutex )
00545     {
00546       if( to_remove_numlinks != 0 )
00547         V_w( &to_remove_entry->lock ) ; /* This was not release yet, it should be done here */
00548 
00549       V_w( &pentry->lock ) ;
00550     }  
00551   
00552   if( status == CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00553     pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_success[CACHE_INODE_REMOVE] += 1 ;
00554   else
00555     pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_REMOVE] += 1 ;
00556   
00557   return status ;
00558 } /* cache_inode_remove */
00559 
00578 cache_inode_status_t cache_inode_remove_no_mutex( cache_entry_t        * pentry,     
00579                                                   fsal_name_t          * pnode_name,
00580                                                   fsal_attrib_list_t   * pattr,
00581                                                   hash_table_t         * ht,  
00582                                                   cache_inode_client_t * pclient, 
00583                                                   fsal_op_context_t          * pcontext, 
00584                                                   cache_inode_status_t * pstatus )
00585 {
00586   return cache_inode_remove_sw( pentry,
00587                                 pnode_name,
00588                                 pattr,
00589                                 ht,
00590                                 pclient,
00591                                 pcontext,
00592                                 pstatus, 
00593                                 FALSE ) ;
00594 } /* cache_inode_remove_no_mutex */

00615 cache_inode_status_t cache_inode_remove( cache_entry_t        * pentry,     
00616                                          fsal_name_t          * pnode_name,
00617                                          fsal_attrib_list_t   * pattr,
00618                                          hash_table_t         * ht,  
00619                                          cache_inode_client_t * pclient, 
00620                                          fsal_op_context_t          * pcontext, 
00621                                          cache_inode_status_t * pstatus )
00622 {
00623   return cache_inode_remove_sw( pentry,
00624                                 pnode_name,
00625                                 pattr,
00626                                 ht,
00627                                 pclient,
00628                                 pcontext,
00629                                 pstatus, 
00630                                 TRUE ) ;
00631 } /* cache_inode_remove_no_mutex */
